intro: Pedicularis wilhelmsiana, commonly known as the yellow monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble tiny monkeys, hence its common name. The plant is a hemiparasitic species, meaning it partially relies on other plants for water and nutrients through its root system. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens for its ornamental value.
